detaileddescription.para: Type that is stored inside vector.
Number of individual values stored by object. This value can be used to iterate over elements.
Default constructor. Sets zero to whole vector.

Initializes vector with value from other vector.
init
Object which value will be copied.

Initializes vector but using __m256i type.
init
Raw value to be set.

Initialize vector with values read from an array.
init
Array from which values will be copied.

Initializes vector by loading data from memory (via _mm256_lddq_si256).
pSrc
Valid memory addres of minimal size of 256-bits (32 bytes).
std::invalid_argument
If in Debug mode and pSrc is nullptr. In Release mode no checks are performed to improve efficiency.

Initializes all vector fields with single value.
b
A literal value to be set.

Initializes vector with variable-length initializer list. If list contains less then 16 values missing values will be filled with zeros. Otherwise only first 16 values will be copied into vector.
init
Initializer list from which values will be copied.

Loads data from memory into vector (memory should be of size of at least 32 bytes). Memory doesn't need to be aligned to any specific boundary. If sP is nullptr this method has no effect.
pSrc
Pointer to memory from which to load data.
std::invalid_argument
If in Debug mode and pSrc is nullptr. In Release mode no checks are performed to improve efficiency.

Saves data to destination in memory.
dest
Reference to the list to which vector will be saved. Array doesn't need to be aligned to any specific boundary.
Saves data to destination in memory. The memory doesn't have to be aligned to any specific boundary.

See https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/c/aligned_alloc for more details.
pDest
A valid pointer to a memory of at least 32 bytes (16x short).
std::invalid_argument
If in Debug mode and pDest is nullptr. In Release mode no checks are performed to improve efficiency.
Saves data to destination in memory. The memory must be aligned at 32-byte boundary.

See https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/c/aligned_alloc for more details.
pDest
A valid pointer to a memory of at least 32 bytes (16x short).
std::invalid_argument
If in Debug mode and pDest is nullptr. In Release mode no checks are performed to improve efficiency.

Get the internal vector value.
The value of __m256i vector.

Set the internal vector value.
value
New value to be set.

Indexing operator.
index
Position of desired element between 0 and 15.
Value of underlying element.
std::out_of_range
If index is not within the correct range.

Compares with second vector for equality.
bV
Object to compare.
true if all elements are equal or false if not.

Compares with value for equality.
b
Value to compare.
true if all elements are equal to passed value false if not.

Compares with second vector for inequality.
bV
Object to compare.
true if any alement is not equal to corresponding element in bV otherwise false.

Compares with value for inequality.
b
Value
true if any alement is not equal to corresponding element in bV otherwise false.

Adds values from other vector and returns new vector.
bV
Second vector.
Short256 New vector being a sum of this vector and bV.

Adds single value across all vector fields.
b
Value to add to vector.
Short256 New vector being a sum of this vector and b.

Adds two vectors together and stores result inside original vector.
bV
Second vector.
Reference to same vector after adding bV to vector.

Adds scalar to vector and stores result inside original vector.
b
Scalar to be added.
Reference to same vector after adding b to vector.

Subtracts values from vector.
bV
Second vector.
Short256 New vector being result of subtracting bV from vector.

Subtracts a single value from all vector fields.
b
Value to subtract from vector.
Short256 New vector being result of subtracting b from vector.

Subtracts two vectors and stores result inside original vector.
bV
Second vector.
Reference to same vector after subtracting bV from vector.

Subtracts scalar from vector and stores result inside original vector.
b
Scalar to be subtracted.
Reference to same vector after subtracting b from vector.

Multiplies two vectors.
bV
Second vector.
Short256 New vector being result of multiplying vector by bV.

Multiplies all vector fields by a single value.
b
Value to multiply by.
Short256 New vector being result of multiplying vector by b.

Multiplies two vectors and stores result inside original vector.
bV
Second vector.
Reference to same vector after multiplying by bV.

Multiplies vector by scalar and stores result inside original vector.
b
Scalar to multiply by.
Reference to same vector after multiplying by b.
Performs an integer division. Utilizes casting to float to compensate for lack of native integer division in AVX and AVX2.

simplesect.para: Result of integer division with truncation.

detaileddescription.para: Performs an integer division.

simplesect.para: Short256 New object containing result of division with truncation.

detaileddescription.para: Performs integer division with assignment by scalar.

simplesect.para: Short256& Reference to the modified object.

detaileddescription.para: Performs a modulo operation.

NOTE: Analogously as in / and /= operators values are casted before performing a division.
bV
Divisors vector.
Modulo result.
Performs a modulo operation.

NOTE: Analogously as in / and /= operators values are casted before performing a division.
bV
Divisor.
Modulo result.

Bitwise OR operator.
bV
Second vector.
Short256 New vector being result of bitwise OR with bV.

Bitwise OR operator with scalar.
b
Value to OR with.
Short256 New vector being result of bitwise OR with b.

Bitwise OR assignment operator. Applies bitwise OR between this vector and the given vector, storing the result in this vector.
bV
Second vector.
Reference to the modified object.

Bitwise OR assignment operator. Applies bitwise OR between this vector and the given value, storing the result in this vector.
b
Value.
Reference to the modified object.

bV
Second vector.
Short256 New vector being result of bitwise AND with bV.

Bitwise AND operator with scalar.
b
Value to AND with.
Short256 New vector being result of bitwise AND with b.

Bitwise AND assignment operator. Applies bitwise AND between this vector and the given vector, storing the result in this vector.
bV
Second vector.
Reference to the modified object.

Bitwise AND assignment operator. Applies bitwise AND between this vector and the given value, storing the result in this vector.
b
Value.
Reference to the modified object.

Bitwise XOR operator.
bV
Second vector.
Short256 New vector being result of bitwise XOR with bV.

Bitwise XOR operator with scalar.
b
Value to XOR with.
Short256 New vector being result of bitwise XOR with b.

Bitwise XOR assignment operator. Applies bitwise XOR between this vector and the given vector, storing the result in this vector.
bV
Second vector.
Reference to the modified object.

Bitwise XOR assignment operator. Applies bitwise XOR between this vector and the given value, storing the result in this vector.
b
Value.
Reference to the modified object.

Performs left bitwise shift of corresponding values.
bV
Second vector that specifies number of bits to shift (for each 16-bit value).
New value of v shifted by number of bits specfied in bV.

Bitwise left shift operator by scalar.
shift
Number of bits by which values should be shifted.
Short256 New vector after left shift.

Bitwise left shift assignment operator (element-wise).
bV
Vector containing number of bits for which each corresponding element should be shifted.
Reference to modified object.

Bitwise left shift assignment operator by scalar.
shift
Number of bits by which values should be shifted.
Reference to modified object.

Bitwise right shift operator (element-wise, arithmetic shift).
bV
Vector containing number of bits for which each corresponding element should be shifted.
Short256 New vector after right shift.

Bitwise right shift operator by scalar (arithmetic shift).
shift
Number of bits by which values should be shifted.
Short256 New vector after right shift.

Bitwise right shift assignment operator (element-wise, arithmetic shift).
bV
Vector containing number of bits for which each corresponding element should be shifted.
Reference to modified object.

Bitwise right shift assignment operator by scalar (arithmetic shift).
shift
Number of bits by which values should be shifted.
Reference to modified object.
Class providing vectorized version of short. Can hold 16 individual short values. Provides arithmetic and bitwise operators. Provides comparison operators == !=.
